attributes.action: Cancel plans to open a trading office in Raleigh North Carolina
attributes.background: Recently North Carolina has passed a bill dubbed 'HB 2' which has "voided all local ordinances protecting LGBT rights". As a result many business ventures have removed or cancelled their investment plans in the state. The UK should also refuse to support a region that legalises LGBT discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: "North Carolina has lost a string of big investment ventures over Governor Pat McCrory’s decision to sign the contentious HB 2 – which voided all local ordinances protecting LGBT rights, banned transgender people from using their preferred bathroom, and permits businesses to discriminate against LGBT people on the grounds of religious belief" http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2016/07/26/uk-government-to-open-trade-hub-in-north-carolina-despite-controversy-over-anti-lgbt-law/

attributes.action: Organise a Great Exhibition
attributes.background: Trade Delegations from all over the World coming to see what Britain has to offer in all its diversity. Every aspect of Britain and British Life can be represented, and as well as the trade Deals we can make, think of the tremendous impact on Tourism from people coming from all over the World.
attributes.additional_details:
Those Britons who worked so hard on our behalf for the Olympics as Ambassadors can welcome overseas visitors, show people around and generally be involved. 
British Royalty is revered and respected all over the World, and they can take part as did Prince Albert for the 1851 Exhibition.
We can find a way for every person in the UK to have a personal investment in this project, engendering a feeling of pride and ownership in Project Great Britain.

attributes.action: Grant British citizenship to all settled EU nationals in UK
attributes.background: Most EU nationals who are setteled in UK, made UK their home, have mortgages, pay taxes and their kids attend schools across Britain are feared that after UK left EU their right to live and work in UK will be ceased and this will have a detremental impact on their life!

attributes.action: Condemn the Xenophobia of UK Tabloids and Ensure EU Free Movement Continues.
attributes.background: We call on MPs to condemn incitement by our tabloid press against foreigners and enact laws making it an offence. We call for a relationship with Europe that allows free movement from the EU so talented business people, scientists, academics, skilled workers & engineers feel welcome & not hated.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/jul/11/police-blame-worst-rise-in-recorded-hate-on-eu-referendum. 
http://www.un.org/apps/news/story.asp?NewsID=50675#.V4YqavkrLmE
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/brexit-britain-latest-news-academics-threaten-to-quit-brain-drain-over-racist-xenophobic-eu-a7133316.html
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/brexitvote/2016/06/29/letter-to-mps-from-a-remain-voter-a-plea-for-realism-tolerance-and-honesty/
http://nyti.ms/29H7OnH

attributes.action: Make welfare forms easier to understand for people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: As a young adult with a learning disability and autism. i have found that most forms that are used by local councils and the DWP are in a format that many people with a learning disability will struggle to understand and process them leading applicants to get anxious and reluctant to apply.
attributes.additional_details: When corresponding the information. the letters and forms don't always specify what you need to send off, and the way the questions are phrased or relayed a person with a disabilitiy wont understand what is in front of them or will struggle look at all information, so the councils and dwp need to make all official documents learning disability friendly

attributes.action: Stop the HMRC phone number being a premium rate and make it free.
attributes.background:
This number is mainly used by people on a low income, elderly people on pensions and those that are registered disabled.
It's charging the people that are less fortunate and really can't afford it.
And average call to the tax office I have found has been 30minutes minimum

attributes.action: Introduce a radical overhaul of British football’s development of youth talent.
attributes.background: We call on Tracey Crouch MP (minister of Sport) and the government, to implement a German-style ‘Extended Talent Promotion Programme’ within British football. We need a similar radical overhaul of how we coach youth football, how we structure our youth development, and how we nurture young talent.

attributes.action: Give the right to vote to EU citizens having lived in the UK for 5 years or more
attributes.background: EU residents, who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more, have the right to get UK citizenship. However many people do not exercise this option for various reasons and, consequently, they do not have the right to vote. Brexit referendum has shown risks deriving from the lack of this voting right
attributes.additional_details: EU residents are net contributors to the UK economy and represent a crucial asset for the sustainable development of this country. Giving voting rights to EU residents who have lived in the UK for 5 years or more would mean the recognition of a fair right and would allow EU residents to have their say on topics that have a direct impact on their lives (such as the recent EU referendum)

attributes.action: Prevent this divided UK referendum catastrophe from ever happening again.
attributes.background:
No matter which way we voted in the Brexit referendum, we all woke up to a UK where massive economic, political, and social changes in our collective futures were enacted by 51.9% of the voting public and 50% of nation's in the UK. 

Please reform how we do this to avoid it ever happening again.
attributes.additional_details:
We now must deal with the uncertainty wrought by a narrow victory and the division created by having two nations impose their will on two others. 

Once this Europe mess is sorted, we propose the next referendum subject be answered in less divisive manner:

First it must be passed by both Houses of Parliament, that's what they're for.

Then it must gain a majority of voters, which must also total at least 50% of all registered voters.

It must also get a majority in each of our four nations.

attributes.action: Introduce a direct democracy which gives power back to citizens
attributes.background: Direct democracy allows any citizen to challenge any law approved by the parliament or, at any time, propose a modification of the federal Constitution. Switzerlands direct democracy holds referendums to decide on new and current legislation. Its time to bring democracy back to the UK.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election by May 2017 to ensure UK not governed by unelected PM
attributes.background: During the referendum the Leave campaign continually stressed that a key issue was not wanting to be governed by unelected representatives (even though EU has elected MEPs). Therefore, now there is such key work to be done, we must have a nationally elected Prime Minister, not a nominated one.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament needs to act to call a General Election before May 2017 to ensure that key decisions are taken with a true mandate. As part of this, no action should be taken by any interim prime minister to activate Article 50 of the 2009 Lisbon Treaty.

attributes.action: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate students' mobile phones
attributes.background: Phones should not be confiscated because it is the students personal property. Schools have no technical right to be able to take their phones as they have no possession over the property.

attributes.action: Regulate wasteful, non-essential overnight lighting of non-residential buildings
attributes.background: Seeking to improve & regulate employer's environmental policies requiring shops, offices and public sector buildings to turn off all unnecessary lighting overnight, allowing local councils to make exceptions for Christmas and other special occasions, and in certain tourist or cultural areas, only.
attributes.additional_details:
Follow the example of France, which introduced in 2013 the new law seeking to significantly reduce light pollution and carbon emissions by allowing local authorities to enforce fines on businesses breaking the rules, while cutting off power to repeat offenders. 

The rules should seek to target non-essential overnight lighting of shop windows and the fronts of buildings, making businesses greener & aware of their social responsibility, while significantly cutting carbon emissions per annum.

attributes.action:
Make it illegal for UK private nurseries to charge parents for 
Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Private nurseries in the UK charge parents for every Bank Holiday in the UK (8 in total) but the nursery remains closed. This can cost parents in excess over £1,000 PER CHILD before a child turns school age. Parents are paying for a service that is not provided and does not exist.

attributes.action: Require NHS Trusts to publish amounts paid for early severance etc.
attributes.background: At a time when it is so important that expenditure in the NHS is not only well controlled and appropriately targeted, NHS Trusts should be required to publicly account for such payments.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence recently published by the Eastern Daily Press shows that £6m  was spent in two years by East of England Ambulance Service.  Another Ambulance Service appears to have expended significant amounts but does not quantify that and other NHS trusts have failed to reveal this information.  At a time when it is so important that expenditure in the NHS is not only well controlled and appropriately targeted, NHS Trusts should be required to publicly account for such payments.

attributes.action: Make voting a legal requirement
attributes.background: In Australia most noteablly, but in other countries to, voting in all official elections (local and general elections) is a legal requirement. Punishable under court of law, usually with a hefty fine.
attributes.additional_details: With many local councils registered a 35% or lower turn out rate, democracy is all but dead in this country (cited by BBC) I want to ensure that we get large turnouts for general elections, local elections and national referendums (eg EU). This will have the knock on effect of bring the power back to the public of the UK and reinstating a true reflection of what the nation wants as its governments

attributes.action: Invest in cleaning up and preventing the pollution in the River Thames
attributes.background: The Thames is an integral natural landmark in London, one of the best there are in the UK. Pollution in recent years has been a rising problem across the world, but in this river alone thousands of animals have died or been poisoned, and the water resource is unused by the public entirely.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to lock toilets during lesson times and break times
attributes.background: My daughters and other children at school are forced to wait up to 20 minutes for someone to come and unlock the school toilets - this is not right. There are children with bladder difficulties and girls who need toilet access. Do you think it's appropriate to have them locked? I certainly do not.

attributes.action: Bring back Capital Punishment for Convicted Terrorists and Killers.
attributes.background:
It is time to send a strong message to those that would halm innocent unsuspecting ordinary law abiding people.
And to ensure that when terrorists or Killers are convicted and found guilty that they are perminatly removed from our society!

attributes.action: For Jeremy Hunt to spend a day working on an NHS mental Health ward
attributes.background: Since this Goverment has been in power Mental health services funding has declined year on year and Mental health issues in the population are rising and staffing levels in hospitals are at breaking point. Jeremy Hunt  does not have any idea of the real world of Mental Health.

attributes.action: Allow the public to decide the order private members' bills are debated.
attributes.background: Allow the public to vote on the order private members' bills are debated on the days set aside for such bills. This facility (and the relevant bills) should be advertised and an interface, similar to this one, should allow the public to vote for the bills they want to be debated on the day.
attributes.additional_details: The percentage of votes cast should determine the order the private members' bills are debated and also which bills are debated. A bill will need to receive at least 25% of the votes cast to be debated on a particular day, and debating time should be allocated by the speaker according to the percentage of votes cast for the qualifying bills.

attributes.action: Bring selling property in England and wales in line with Scottish system
attributes.background: Scotland has a fairer system in buying and selling property, we need the laws to change in England and Wales, no more gazumping or being held to ransom by estate agents and conveyancing solicitors

attributes.action: Mr Cameron to speak to Indian Prime minister to free 6 innocent Britons
attributes.background: In 2013 Indian police boarded a vessel and arrested all the crew for corruption. Including 6 innocent maritime security operatives who were oblivious that the weapons on board were not legitimately licensed. They have been in an Indian Prison since & our Prime Minister has done NOTHING about it.WHY?
attributes.additional_details:
ADVAFORT the maritime security responsible for this negligence has done NOTHING to try and help these 6 innocent men,
Here is an official news link to the story

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-34095843

attributes.action: Reverse the Government's proposed huge hike's in VED due in April 2017
attributes.background:
Significant changes announced in the 2015 Budget will see UK drivers subjected to huge rises in VED from 2017.

VED charged on cars is currently linked to exhaust emissions.  Under changes announced, the existing 13 bands will be replaced by just 3 VED bands for all new cars sold.
attributes.additional_details:
Motivation for buying low-emissions cars will be swept away.

Why not simply move the VED CO2 bandings down, continuing to incentivise buyers to look at ever more efficient cars?

These changes due to commence in April 2017 do not reward or promote low C02 emissions, do not support the Governments targets for the environment and are further ‘under the counter’’ tax on income without any focus on true road use or rewarding buyers of low emission vehicles.

attributes.action: We demand that the government seek to bring the railways into public ownership.
attributes.background:
The UK's rail network is state owned... but not by the British state. It belongs to no fewer than two other European governments! The rest of it is owned and ran by private companies.
Fares are rising year upon year. Quality isn't... 

We want a people's rail. A rail ran in people's interests
attributes.additional_details:
(a) The demand for public ownership: 

- Cross party support in the House of Commons for the Railways Bill since 2013. 
- 66% of voters support. (YouGov 2013)
- FOUR major transport unions back it. (TSSA, ASLEF, UNITE and RMT)

(b) The dire need for it:

-Rail fares have risen THREE times faster than wages in the last 5 years.

- Rail fares gobble up at least 13% of the average monthly pay packet.

- Fares rise year upon year. 25% since 2010.

- If nationalised, you could cut fares by 62p per £1

attributes.action: Allow non VAT registered businesses reliant on a vehicle to claim VAT back on it
attributes.background: I'm a self employed Tradesman trying to make a living. Going VAT registered isn't an option as that makes me 20% more expensive than other Tradesmen. I rely on my van to do my job, but I cannot claim the VAT on my main asset,(£4-5k in VAT). We are unable to trade without a van, please reconsider VAT
attributes.additional_details: Vans are expensive and we need reliable ones. VAT is additional money that we can't claim back unlike VAT registered companies. This gives an advantage to those in the commercial sector as VAT amongst companies is welcomed but VAT in the domestic sector is crippling when it comes to competing with other tradesmen. We need to be able to claim the VAT back, not necessarily all of it but please at least reconsider the effect it has on the sole traders in the UK

attributes.action: Introduce stringent pre-assessment guidelines for TVT devices.
attributes.background:
My pre-assessment was minimal and vague,I was told that the procedure was simple and i would walk out within 24 hours. 
I was never informed of the nerve, blood vessel and bladder injury that could and did occur.
attributes.additional_details:
I have an anatomy and medical back ground,and i have spent 7 years studying POP. Pelvic Organ Prolapse.
Many women, and men have been injured with these devices, which are made of plastic.
My concern is that these devices have been inserted willy-nilly.
Direction,planning and pre-assessment of the patient is paramount before inserting any device.

attributes.action:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
And make cyclist use the cycle paths
attributes.background: I was driving the other day just come round the bend and there was 3 of them next to eachover taking up the road and could not pass its so dangerous
attributes.additional_details:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
I would like the government to ban cycle racing on public roads. On our busy streets their is no place for sports cycle racing, its highly dangerous with cyclists often racing three abreast and not moving in on narrow roads to allow faster traffic to pass. clubs should rent tracks to race on cars and motorbikes have to , cyclists pay no road tax,have no insurance etc, pleasure cycling and commuting should be encouraged on cycle paths only but racing banned

attributes.action: Repeal tail docking ban for KC working breeds at the very least The Dobermann
attributes.background: In 2007 the government banned the docking of tails, but allowed some working breeds to continue to be docked, 9yrs down the line and the amount of damaged tails is causing immeasurable suffering Please think carefully and help to end the suffering of these dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence will be updated daily here from July 26th 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1753160231634236/
Repeal the ban or at the very least allow all breeds classified as Working Group dogs have their tails docked by a vet. Older dogs having tails amputated is not acceptable.The Doberman has been 
traditionally docked from its creation, now with tails we have 
varying degrees of length carriage and thickness this is causing unnecessary suffering. Allow docking by a vet within 3 days of birth.

attributes.action: Provide the date when permanent residence was acquired through EEA regulations
attributes.background: Since the 12 November 2015 to apply for naturalisation EEA nationals and their non EEA family members must have been issued with a document certifying permenanet residence (DCPR) or with a permanent residency card (PRC), but the date when permanent residence was acquired is not reported on either.
attributes.additional_details:
In general to apply for naturalisation one must have indefinite leave to stay in the UK for the last 12 months of residence. The Home Office Nationality Policy Team has been advising via FOI that for whose requesting DCPRs or PRCs "the date that they were deemed to have acquired permanent residence will be recorded on UKVI’s database and so will be clear to the nationality caseworker".
Not providing the date to the applicants, except than by SAR, increases red tape and slows down naturalisations

attributes.action: Bring back levels for assessment and stop labelling our children as failures.
attributes.background: Children who don't meet the expected standard for their year group are being assessed as emerging and not 'Year _ ready'. Essentially we are telling them they have failed! Children need encouragement not labelling in this way. Levels mean that progress can easily be seen year on year.
attributes.additional_details: A whole generation of our children risk being labelled failures by the system that replaced levels. Previously a child and their parents would easily see progress during a school year by looking at their levels. Currently they are labelled as 'emerging', 'expected' or 'exceeding' and a child who is emerging is then described as not being ready for the next year group that they move in to. If our children are to achieve their true potential, we need to stop labelling them as failures!

attributes.action: The U.K. Gov to make it illegal to fly the ISIS (Daesh) flag in the U.K.
attributes.background: ISIS, ISIL or Daesh is a terrorist organisation. The flying if their flag in the UK needs to be made a criminal offence punishable by prison, or deportation, as it encourages terrorism and terrorist sympathy.
attributes.additional_details:
ISIS, ISIL or Daesh is a terrorist organisation. Their flag has been flown in the UK often and should be made illegal. Anyone caught with the flag should be considered a terrorist threat, be immediately arrested as such, and be fully investigated, along with their family and friends for terrorist activities. 

The punishment for flying the flag in public, or being caught with the flag in their home, should be a heavy prison sentance, or deportation.

attributes.action: Make schools remove climbing frames due to the health and safety of the children
attributes.background: I believe that climbing frames are a risk to the health and safety of children when used in a school playground environment. They are at risk of serious injury should they fall or are pushed by another child.
attributes.additional_details:
My daughter had an accident at her local Nursery when playing on the climbing frame, she fell from the top bar and then hit another bar seriously injuring her before she hit the ground.
I feel that children in a school environment are at a higher risk of injury from playing on a climbing frame than if they were playing on one in a park with their parents there to supervise.

attributes.action: We should have a referendum to quit NATO and save us from starting a major war.
attributes.background: NATO is not big enough to win a war against Russia, but large enough to start a world war.  This makes it a waste of tax payers money.  NATO has broken its agreement to expand beyond Germany, causing unease with Russia and making us impose US led sanctions, which have made UK farmers suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/601058/Britain-European-Union-Russia-Foreign-Policy-Agriculture-Farmers-Dairy-Phil-Hogan-Milk

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/french-farmers-block-roads-in-protest-at-huge-drop-in-milk-and-pork-prices-following-russian-trade-a6875581.html

http://www.southeastfarmer.net/section/news/eu-sanctions-hit-uk-fruit-growers

attributes.action: Disability football should get more recognition
attributes.background: I Strongly Believe That Disability Football Should be Recognized more as a normal thing in society and that our government should support it more by supplying more funding and more publicity,
attributes.additional_details: Football can play a key role in any persons development let alone a disabled persons development, It can help them get Independence, socialize more and develop fine motor skills. Most football clubs run Disability football and it should get recognize more just like main stream football.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election at the start of 2017 with proportional representation.
attributes.background: This is a vote of no confidence in the current British Government in light of the EU Refurendum and is a call by the people to form a completely new government. With our prime minister stepping down and calling for new leadership we feel that this should be decided by all the people not by the few.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a significant proportion of people who are upset with the outcome of the referendum and over 2 million are petitioning for another. 

There is a strong majority that feel that their opinions, ideologies and voices are not heard due to our current first past post political popularity contest. 

With a 72% vote on the referendum, people are more politically minded than ever and we should utilise this opportunity to elect a government of the people proportionally elected by the people.

attributes.action: Stop the UK Government leaving the EU without consent from Scottish Parliament.
attributes.background:
Brexit politicians misled millions of voters on immigration, funding, the NHS, and the economic impact of leaving the EU.

We the undersigned call on David Cameron and Nicola Sturgeon to ensure the views of the Scottish people are represented and cease the process of leading the UK out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland has to agree to the UK leaving the EU in order for Brexit to go ahead. A second referendum is extremely unlikely. The best chance we have of stopping the UK proceeding with leaving the EU is for the Scottish Parliament to refuse to give formal legislative consent.

attributes.action: Referendums must garner over 50% in all four nations of the UK to be passed
attributes.background: Referendums risk the break-up of the United Kingdom, if the four nations vote in different ways, as devolved parliaments can cite "material changes" that allow a referendum of independence in their respective nations to be carried out.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Kngdom is a valued but vulnerable Union. The U.K. Parliament must respect the views of the constituent nations when consulting the public over constitutional matters. Therefore, referendums must require the support of each constituent nation (England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland). 

The undersigned wish this to be enforced retrospectively, including the recent EU referendum.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nigel Farage in the Parliament for UK Independance Day.
attributes.background: Nigel Farage dedicated his life to Britain's freedom. The exit from EU was only possible thanks to his decades long struggle against EU bureaucracy and him raising awareness. As a way to celebrate the man and his accomplishments we would like to erect a statue of himself in the Members' Lobby.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the Migration Impact Fund
attributes.background: The first Cameron ministry scraped the Migration Impact Fund in 2010. The £50million fund was set up by the Brown ministry to help local government deal with the effects of pressure of high levels of immigration. By reintroducing this fund we can ensure that migration benefits everyone in society.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2010/aug/06/fund-impact-immigration-scrapped

attributes.action: Change the law so that cowboy trades people are prosecuted in a criminal court
attributes.background: People save hard to have construction work done at there property, only to hire a trades person who stops work half way through a job leaving the home owner with an unfinished property and thousands of pounds out of pocket. This should be considered a criminal offence as county court is no deterrent
attributes.additional_details: Rogue trades people are often taken to county court by home owners when a trades person does not complete the work he/she has been contracted to complete. If the home owner wins the case the trades person will have a county court judgement which the home owner will then have to enforce if the trades person does not pay. This still does not guarantee that the home owner will receive any money. County court judgements are no deterrent to a trades person that has no assets that can be seized.

attributes.action: Fully fund University Education for priority careers e.g. Health,Sciences Eng...
attributes.background: We desperately need Doctors, Scientists, Engineers, yet every year we fail to train in sufficient numbers whilst pumping out graduates in law, media, politics, travel and more exotic topics which rarely lead to careers where our society needs them most.
attributes.additional_details:
We must encourage more students entering higher education to consider where society needs them most by offering to fully fund their academic fees on the basis that they first qualify and then agree to work in their chosen field here in the UK for a minimum of 10 years after qualifying or the fee's - based on a sliding scale will be recoverable.
These publicly funded places should be offered entirely to satisfy the needs of our society and no other consideration should be evaluated or allowed.

attributes.action: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda
attributes.background: Life sentence for spreading ISIS propaganda, publicly supporting ISIS or  getting people to join ISIS.

attributes.action: Make edible ring holders compulsory for the protection of marine and wildlife.
attributes.background: Saltwater Brewery in Florida invented a 100% biodegradable, edible 6-pack ring holder using brewing waste products such as barley and wheat. I call on the government to legislate, or at least incentivise the introduction of edible ring holders to replace dangerous plastic ones that harm marine life.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/craft-beer-brewery-creates-an-edible-six-pack-ring-which-fees-not-chokes-marine-wildlife_uk_573db844e4b03f08843e3ee3

attributes.action: more research doing into duchenne muscular dystrophy and help find a cure please
attributes.background: Would like more research doing into duchenne muscular dystrophy to help find a cure for all the little kids that have been found to have it myself I have a nearly 3 year old that's got duchenne muscular dystrophy and have found out our other son might also have duchenne muscular dystrophy

attributes.action: Disclose paedophiles names and addresses to protect our children !
attributes.background: Pedophiles live near our children everyday.  If your that much of a risk you need to sign a register then why can we not be aware. You name and shame dealers. Now name and shame pedophiles

attributes.action: Stop the force of adoption from innocent young mums!
attributes.background: I fell in love at a young age like most of us do, it was a confusing time but I though that was it life was perfect, so when I fell pregnant and then found out it was twins! I had my family for life but then because of my age social workers started sniffing around.
attributes.additional_details: I had a good childhood, just my mum and siblings but we had it good  (not having a father around made my decision to keep my babies easier!) I had never even heard of social services until I got pregnant. I got allocated a family nurse  (who befriended me,secretly was against my pregnancy) from there the child snatching plan begun, me and my partner went into a unit together to bring up our children independently , they let me dote over them for a year while secretly finding them a new mum.

attributes.action: Allow regions of England  to hold a referendum on regional  assemblies
attributes.background: the recent revelations of the panama papers highlights the Westminster bubble i feel power should devolved into the hands of the people, it would give  a greater voice to regions such as the north and the midlands who are not being represented by a London focused Westminster
attributes.additional_details: i am aware john Prescott attempted something similarly in the past but the direct democracy of regional assembly remains the way forward as these assemblies would be better placed to dealing with local issues and would more accountable to the voters giving the proximity to them it would also ease the load on central government the is already support for regional assembles in England http://www.wessexregionalists.info/ and http://www.thenortheastparty.org.uk/

attributes.action: SIA frontline officers to be granted with more power and equipted with PPE
attributes.background: Security Officers deal with violent and aggressive and drunken individuals each day, thus they are vulnerable in frontline. They have no powers apart from Common Law powers and have no Personal Protective Equipment.
attributes.additional_details: Each day we see in media of security officers been attacked,stabbed or even more been killed. We are asking government to grant powers to Security Officers and make Personal Protective Equipment mandatory throught the industry. This way, our security officer colleagues will be safe in frontline.

attributes.action: Change mandatory jail sentence for rape, rather than community service.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the jail sentence length and to rule out community service. The victims of these charges deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Two women under 16 were raped by a man aged 17 (now 18) and he got off with 18 months community service. He put these two girls and their families through hell and he basically got away with it. What is community service going to do to help these two girls go about their lives without having to keep looking over there shoulders. How does having an unstable mind allow this man to not get jail time.
